body.p:
Being in possession of your
esteemed favour of May 29th I avail myself of
this opportunity to reply thereto, and likewise to
convey the united thanks of Mrs. Myers and myself
for the very kind sentiments and wishes on the occasion
of our happy union, and which are contained in
your esteemed communication. Rest assured
Revd and Dear Sir that I fully appreciate such
honor at your hands, and that your kind &
distinguished patronage can but lend to stimulate
me in my humble exertions towards the cause
of our holy faith, and thereby allow me to
prove myself worthy of the kind consideration
bestowed upon me. I also take this oppor=
=tunity of most sincerely thanking you (Dr Sir)
for the kind notices which you have been
pleased to take of my humble exertions; and
which have appeared in your valuable periodical,
and the only fear and regret that I entertain,
is, that in such instances you may have
been induced to overrate my feeble abilities
and exertions: for I assure you Revd Sir that
whatever steps I take for advocating the truths of

our holy religion is are not based upon my own
abilities but on the advice “Hebrew”
I have Dr Sir to beg your excuse for being so
long neglectful in opening our correspondence,
although I have for the last twelve months
so often projected so to do, and from time to
time been prevented accomplishing my desire,
but, I trust that you will pardon the delay,
and now that the commencement has taken
place, that it may continue uninterrupted;
for, I assure you that it will a source of
great satisficion and delight to me, to have
the honor of your correspondence, and also of replying
thereto.

I thank you sincerely for your kind advice, and
assure you that I shall never become weary
of my work in the vineyard of the Eternal; nor,
do I allow occasional ingratitude to dampen
my exertions; for we must in every flock
expect to find some few silly sheep who will
wander away form the shepherd, however carefully
he may watch their movements. However, ?
I have but a few such sheepish heads in my
flock. You are already made aware that
in the month of January I paid a visit to the
Island of Curacoa, and it is gratifying for me to
inform you, that I have just received a
very handsome testimonial from the community
there, in the shape of a ? of a very handsome, silver

goblets with stands to match, each one bearing
the inscription of its being presented to me by my
coreligionists and admirers of at Curacoa.

I have not at present any particular
news to communicate. With most sincere &
best wishes, and assurances of my high regard
I have the honor to be

You would greatly oblige me if at your
earliest convenience you would by the very
first opportunity supply me with a copy
of the regulations of the Philadelphia Heb
Sunday School; and also 6 copies of
the most suitable book, the contents of
which you deem that candidates for
confirmation in our Holy faith should be
acquainted with.
